briefdescription.para: FP32 baseline.
BF16 compute/storage.
FP16 compute/storage.
Floating-point precision flags for convenience.

detaileddescription.para: Note: int8w/int4/int4w are treated as labels; only fp32/bf16/fp16 map to the compact enum used by this file.

briefdescription.para: No pretranspose.
Pretranspose W_O * H.
Pretranspose W_X * H.
Pretranspose all eligible matrices.
Pretranspose policy hint for weight layouts.
Get a monotonic timestamp in seconds.

detaileddescription.para: This is used for benchmark timing and must not be affected by wall-clock changes (NTP adjustments, manual clock edits).

simplesect.para: Current monotonic time in seconds, as a double.

briefdescription.para: Parse an environment variable as a base-10 long integer.

detaileddescription.para: If the variable is unset, empty, or contains invalid characters, this function returns defv.

simplesect.para: Parsed long value, or defv on error/unset.

briefdescription.para: Get an environment variable as a string, with a default fallback.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the environment value, or defv.

briefdescription.para: Check whether a filesystem path exists.

detaileddescription.para: This uses stat(2) and returns success for any filesystem node type (regular file, directory, symlink target, etc.).

briefdescription.para: Check whether a path is an accessible directory.

detaileddescription.para:
The directory must:
exist,
be a directory,
be readable and searchable (R_OK|X_OK).

briefdescription.para: Case-insensitive ASCII equality check (NULL-safe).

detaileddescription.para: This intentionally performs ASCII-only folding and does not depend on locale.

simplesect.para: 1 if equal ignoring ASCII case, 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Check whether a string starts with a given prefix (byte-wise).

simplesect.para: 1 if s starts with prefix, 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Check whether a path is absolute (POSIX semantics).
Safely copy a string into a fixed buffer.

detaileddescription.para: This always NUL-terminates dst (unless dstsz is 0). It is a convenience wrapper around snprintf to avoid partial memcpy logic.

memberdef.argsstring: (char *out, size_t outsz, const char *dir, const char *leaf)
memberdef.name: join_path

briefdescription.para: Join a directory and a leaf name into a single POSIX path.

detaileddescription.para:
Rules:
If leaf is absolute, it is copied as-is into out.
If dir is NULL/empty, the result is just leaf.
Otherwise result is "dir/leaf" (ensuring exactly one slash).

parameterdescription.para: File name or relative path (must be non-NULL).

briefdescription.para: Attempt to canonicalize a directory path with realpath().

detaileddescription.para: If realpath(3) fails (missing path, permissions, etc.), this function falls back to copying the input directory string into out.

briefdescription.para: Check whether a precision label refers to int4-family weights.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *model_dir, const char *model_json_opt, const char *model_bin_opt, const char *precision, char *out_json, size_t out_json_sz, char *out_bin, size_t out_bin_sz)
memberdef.name: resolve_model_paths

briefdescription.para: Resolve model JSON/BIN paths using CLI overrides, model_dir, and precision.

detaileddescription.para:
Precedence: 1) Explicit model-json / model-bin:
If absolute, used as-is.
If relative and model_dir exists, resolved under model_dir.
If relative and no model_dir, used relative to the current working directory. 2) Otherwise choose defaults under model_dir (or CWD if none):
If precision is int4/int4w: prefer model.ie.compat.json + model.q4.bin if both exist. otherwise fall back to model.ie.json + model.ie.bin.
Else: model.ie.json + model.ie.bin.

parameterdescription.para: Optional JSON override from CLI (may be NULL).
Optional BIN override from CLI (may be NULL).

briefdescription.para: Print CLI usage information to stderr.

detaileddescription.para: This intentionally prints to stderr so stdout can be reserved for the benchmark JSON line.

briefdescription.para: Initialize a cli_extras_t with default values.

detaileddescription.para: Defaults are chosen to be benchmark-friendly and stable across environments.

briefdescription.para: Convert a string to a base-10 long with strict validation.

detaileddescription.para: On parsing failure, this prints an error and exits with code 2. This keeps the rest of the flag parsing code branch-free and predictable.

briefdescription.para: Parse command-line flags into a cli_extras_t container.

detaileddescription.para:
Parsing rules:
Unknown flags cause an error and return -1.
A non-flag token (no leading '-') is treated as a positional prompt, unless prompt already set it.
This function does not allocate memory; it only stores pointers into argv.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on error or if help was printed.

briefdescription.para: Read the first non-empty line from a text file.

detaileddescription.para: This is used when the harness provides a prompts file but expects a single prompt per run (non-aggregate mode). The first non-empty line is selected, stripped of trailing newlines.

parameterdescription.para: Output buffer to receive the line.

simplesect.para: 1 if a line was read, 0 if the file had no non-empty lines, -1 on I/O error.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32_t n_tok, const uint32_t *tokens, double wall_s_in, uint64_t kv_hits, uint64_t kv_misses, uint32_t rss_peak_mb)
memberdef.name: print_json_result

briefdescription.para: Print a single JSON summary line for the last run.

detaileddescription.para: Output is always a single object on stdout so that external harness scripts can parse results reliably. Token arrays are included only when a single prompt and single round is used; otherwise an empty array is emitted to avoid huge output.

Latency:
p50/p95 here are synthetic placeholders computed from average per-token time (p95 is scaled by 2x). The harness can compute real distributions if it runs multiple iterations.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to tokens (may be NULL to print an empty array).
Wall-clock seconds for the measured window.
Peak RSS in MiB to report.

briefdescription.para: Program entry point.

detaileddescription.para: High-level flow: 1) Parse CLI arguments into a local options container. 2) Export tuning knobs as environment variables for the engine/runtime. 3) Resolve model directory and JSON/BIN paths (precision-aware). 4) Optionally open/touch weights (strict vs stub behavior). 5) Create an engine instance and run optional warmup. 6) Run generation inside a tight timed window, optionally performing a post-token "work-touch" loop to simulate/measure bandwidth. 7) Collect KV hit/miss counters and peak RSS, then print one JSON line. 8) Release resources and exit.

Exit behavior:
Returns 0 on success (including stub mode).
Returns non-zero when strict model requirements fail or engine creation fails.

briefdescription.para: CLI entry point for the inference engine (benchmark-friendly).

detaileddescription.para: This translation unit implements the standalone CLI binary used by the benchmark harness. It is designed to always emit a single JSON object on stdout (even in stub mode), so that external scripts can reliably parse per-run results.

Key behaviors:
CI/Stub mode (default): does not require model files; emits valid JSON.
Strict mode (IE_REQUIRE_MODEL=1): requires model files to open.
Benchmark timing window includes only:
ie_engine_generate(...)
optional per-token "work-touch" loop

Model path resolution:
model-json / model-bin override everything. If relative and model-dir is provided, they are resolved relative to it.
Otherwise, defaults are chosen from model-dir (or inferred model dir):
If effective precision is int4/int4w: prefer model.ie.compat.json + model.q4.bin (if present), otherwise fall back to model.ie.json + model.ie.bin.
Otherwise: use model.ie.json + model.ie.bin.

Runtime knobs (exported as env vars):
GEMV prefetch/streaming: pf-w N -> IE_GEMV_PFDIST_W pf-x N -> IE_GEMV_PFDIST_X force-ntw 0|1 -> IE_GEMV_FORCE_NTW
Sparsity: sparsity none|block|auto -> IE_SPARSITY (when provided)
Dedup (loader/runtime consumes these; main_infer.c only exports knobs): dedup 0|1 -> IE_DEDUP dedup-policy ... -> IE_DEDUP_POLICY dedup-cache-mb N -> IE_DEDUP_CACHE_MB dedup-hot-bytes N -> IE_DEDUP_HOT_BYTES dedup-hot-list STR -> IE_DEDUP_HOT_LIST
